results.title: Retention Specialist - Customer Success
results.description:
Landbot is the most powerful no-code chatbot builder. Our platform helps thousands companies convert leads, capture data, and personalize customer journeys in real-time.

We're on the lookout for a Retention Specialist to join the Success team at Landbot.

For a Retention Specialist, it is all about guaranteeing that our customers get the most out of using our product. Your job will be divided into two main responsibilities:

  1. Retaining our self-service customers by building tech-touch journeys, while learning as much as possible from those who opt-out by designing our off-boarding journeys and making sure the learnings are shared company wide.
  2. Identifying ‘land and expand’ opportunities (logos with a high potential of becoming power users of our product) among the segment above to unlock revenue growth for the company.

If you love happy users, engaged companies, and successful customers, this is your role. You’ll become a Landbot expert and use that knowledge to advise thousands of customers on how to successfully use Landbot to achieve their goals.

You will spend time doing the following: 🚀

  • Planning, executing, and iterating Customer Retention and Expansion strategies to ensure revenue growth.
  • Reporting customer feedback and insights to relevant departments & follow-up.
  • Building meaningful relationships with customers.
  • At least 2 years of experience in SaaS.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Fluency in English & Spanish. 
  • Detail-oriented and organized in everything you do, with a passion for continuously improving processes.
  • Deep understanding of the main startup metrics/KPIs. Knowledge of Customer Success metrics will be a plus.
  • Enjoy interfacing with clients and developing strong relationships.
  • Understand the goals of a project while still keeping the future of Landbot´s product roadmap in mind.
  • Excited about engaging clients while maintaining knowledge on the technical side of the product and company.
  • Eligibility to work in Spain.
  • Good sense of humor and working with a positive attitude.

If we’d have to choose a word that should define each and every team member in Landbot, it would be proactiveness. We want relentlessly resourceful people onboard**!**

Bonus skills & attributes 🙌

  • Any other languages will be a plus.
  • Experience in Startups, ideally in a CS role.
  • Experience in project or account management.
  • Experience with SaaS businesses.

Benefits 😍

  • Hybrid culture: you can choose between a full remote or a beautiful office in Barcelona (or both!). We ask you o be based within GMT-5 and GMT+3 time zones so we have enough overlap to collaborate.
  • We are remote-friendly! 🌍 No matter your location what's important is your contribution.
  • Great company culture, we have a young, upbeat, and international work environment.
  • Flexible schedule.
  • Open vacation policy and flexible holidays so you can take time off when you need it.
  • Top-notch work equipment, but we’re happy to get you whatever equipment to get your job done.
  • Training budget 📚 📖
  • Ticket transport 🚋
  • Fridays- summer are short days.
  • 🏖 25 days of paid vacation (23 regular days + December 24th & 31st ) 🏖
  • English & Spanish lessons 🇬🇧 🇪🇸
  • Flex compensation with Cobee 💸💸 for employees residing in Spain.
  • Team building activities 🎳🍻🍕
  • Referral Bonus if you bring other talented people like you.
  • Others …

results.title: Director of Product Development
results.description:
Onebrief makes military planning seamless and represents a shift in paradigm for future military decisions. It is an all-in-one tool that supports both the creative and process-oriented aspects of military planning. In Onebrief, planners use maps, boards, diagrams, timelines, spreadsheets, slide decks and text documents to create their plans—all while sharing a common database. Everything stays in sync, in real time. Our approach has been refined and validated through hundreds of user experiments.

We’re post-revenue ($3M+ in ARR). We are backed by Y Combinator (S21) and top-tier VCs, including Caffeinated Capital (Affirm, Docker, Notion, and more). Our elite team combines the best of tech and military talent, including education and experience at Google, Adobe, MIT, Delta Force, TOPGUN, and more.

Given our current traction we can barely keep up with demand. This is an opportunity for you to join us with all the perks of a founding employee.

What you will achieve

As a Director of Product Development, your primary responsibility will be to shape our product bets before they are scheduled for implementation. Starting with opportunities identified with our leadership team, you will refine the problem definition, design a high-level solution, mitigate risks and assumption, and establish hard “no-gos,” to make sure that the project can be executed successfully with virtually no risk to schedule.

Shaped bets are rough and unfinished, but they are painstakingly thought through. All the main elements of the solution are there at the macro level and they connect together. The work isn’t specified down to individual tasks, but the overall solution is spelled out. While surprises might still happen, any open questions or rabbit holes we could see up front have been removed to reduce the project’s risk. Shaping bets involves equal parts of product, design and engineering work.

You will have the opportunity to travel and partner with military planners from around the world, empathize with their needs, and translate that into informed product bets. You will collaborate often with leadership, engineering, and design.

This is a critical position, with significant impact.

You will report directly to Rafa, our CTO and co-founder.

About You

The ideal candidates are curious and pragmatic “product people” who understand how software products are built from having done it themselves, either as software engineers or “full-stack” designers.

We are especially interested in candidates who have led product initiatives working on B2B/SaaS projects, involving aspects of creative support, data visualization, or modern collaboration.

Qualifications

  • You have been involved in the building of software products for several years

  • You have led impactful product initiatives, even if Product Manager is not your job title

  • You have a comprehensive understanding of the current state of web technologies and best practices

  • You are naturally inclined to apply a design thinking approach to problem solving, and iteratively seek to understand your users, challenge assumptions, redefine problems and create innovative solutions which you can prototype and test

  • You work effectively with designers and engineers, leading with context, setting clear expectations, and seeking pragmatic solutions

  • You have the skills to create simple solutions for complex problems quickly; often benefiting from tried-and-true techniques

  • You put user value before tech

  • You learn quickly, work iteratively and naturally seek collaboration

  • You communicate clearly and succinctly

  • You are a U.S. citizen

  • Finally, you are a manager of one—capable of setting your own direction, building something from scratch, and seeing it through

About Us

Our team shares a passion, seek excellence, and play to win, with the seriousness and camaraderie of an olympic team. We are in this together, not just because Onebrief will one day be 10x the size of Palantir. We are here to build the future of military decisions, so that the coming decades don’t repeat the previous ones.

Here’s what our team members value most about working here:

  • Founders' transparency

  • Product and vision

  • Leadership's ability to learn and adapt

  • Challenges and learning opportunities

  • Ownership and autonomy

  • No non-sense policies and procedures

  • Remote-first, as opposed to remote-friendly

What's in it for you

  • $170k - $220k salary/year

  • Equity

  • Remote work, flex time, and unlimited PTO

  • Health, dental, vision, and life insurance

  • 401k

  • Parental leave

results.title: Full Stack Software Engineer

About Us

Here at Elevate Security, we're building the world's first-ever proactive insider risk platform focused on enabling enterprises to shift left of loss by identifying the users most likely to cause a breach and orchestrating additional security to minimize the likelihood of an incident.
We're looking for exceptional and passionate people to help us build this future and redefine the burgeoning security landscape.

We're looking for exceptional and passionate people to help us build this future and redefine the security landscape. There are few times when life shows up with a golden ticket. This is one of those times! We are looking for incredible people to join us on our journey. Come join one of the top 10 best tech startups in Berkeley (from anywhere in the world; we're remote)!

What you'll work on

  • You'll implement flexible frontend and backend microservices to enable end users to search, visualize and draw insights from millions of security events streaming in near real-time
  • You will build start of the art applications to empower end users to minimize security risk by providing security workflow automation tooling based on security event streams and employee context
  • You will work together with the team to achieve a good balance of cost, reliability, and ability to move fast to serve our users.
  • You will participate in the entire lifecycle, from idea inception all the way through implementation, rollout and evolution over time. 
  • You'll help us scale our application infrastructure as we go through hypergrowth

Frontend:

  • TypeScript

  • ES6

Backend:

  • Python / Django / Flask
  • Postgres / Redis / MySQL / ElasticSearch

Experience
  • 5+ years of experience building and scaling microservices with react (and/or other javascript) and python web servers
  • Strong customer empathy and desire to work closely with Product, Sales, and Customer Success to build a great product that users love.
  • Breadth of experience building customer-centric products using development best practices.
  • Mastery of at least one programming language. We use Javascript & Python
  • Growth mindset to learn whatever you don't know! 
  • Strong compatibility with our company values.

 

What makes Elevate Security a great place to work?

results.title: Full-Stack Developer (Mid-Level)
results.description:
Description

We're always keeping our eyes out for great people—always looking, carefully hiring. The right person loves collaboration with coworkers and clients and believes it leads to the best work. The right builder also wants to work in a learning-hungry web environment and help lead the web industry by sharing. Sparkbox has been intentionally working to build a team where we acknowledge our own imperfections, make all feel welcome, and humbly help each other grow.

If you're right for this position, you have solid knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (and applicable browser support) while being mindful of the diverse ecosystem of devices and connections. You've gained enough industry experience to have proven success shipping quality web products while collaborating with teams. You care about and are eager to learn the details of deployment, commit history, refactoring, design patterns, web accessibility and other development practices. You understand the value of design systems throughout the product design and development lifecycle and are willing to dig deep on this topic. You have a standards-centric view of the web, know its limitations and possibilities, and care about performance and progressive enhancement.

You will be expected to help craft solutions to client needs, recognizing the constraints of each unique situation. You'll work with our team of designers and developers to turn those solutions into high-quality, well-tested websites and applications that are accessible to as many people as possible.

We're looking for applicants with professional web development experience. To be very clear: if you don't have experience working as a web developer beyond a classroom or a bootcamp, this particular position is not a good match. Instead, you may be a great fit for our Full-Stack Developer Apprenticeship.

Requirements

We're actively looking for individuals that will bring a diverse perspective to the Sparkbox office. Passion and humility are vital, as you'll work directly with our designers, project managers, and other developers at Sparkbox. You'll also interact with clients and should feel comfortable presenting work. You'll need to be hungry to learn new things, advance your skills, and push to find new processes.

A few things you could spend your days with:

  • JavaScript, Typescript, and frameworks such as React, Angular, Vue, and Express
  • CSS, Sass, and CSS-in-JS built responsively for many browsers
  • Clean, semantic HTML
  • Git, Github, CircleCI, Netlify, and Heroku
  • Dynamic Pattern Libraries, Design Systems, Storybook
  • Accessibility (WCAG 2.1 AA or higher) and Progressive Enhancement
  • WordPress, Drupal, ExpressionEngine and other CMS technologies
  • Closely working with UI Designers to translate designs to code
  • Test-Driven Development
  • Continuous Integration and Delivery
  • Potential to lead project teams in partnership with client developers
  • Weekly time dedicated to mentoring more junior team members and apprentices
  • Share your learnings on the Sparkbox blog— Check out The Foundry
Inclusive Mindset

Sparkbox has been intentionally working to build a team where we acknowledge our own imperfections, make all feel welcome, and humbly help each other grow. If you can bring a fresh perspective to a team of humble people who love what they do, we'd love to talk with you.

Benefits & Compensation

Our compensation amount for this role is targeted at $70,000 - $95,000 for all remote locations. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors including candidate skillset and expertise and may vary from the amounts listed in this posting.

In return for your outstanding work, Sparkbox offers the following:

  • Remote work
  • Flexible Schedule
  • Healthcare Insurance
  • Vision Insurance
  • Dental Insurance
  • Group Life Insurance
  • Mental Health Benefit (Employer Paid)
  • Accident, Critical Illness & Hospital Insurance
  • Health Savings Account (Employer Match)

  • Paid Vacation

  • Home-Office Budget
  • Competitive Salary
  • Commission Opportunities
  • Paid Holidays

  • Provided Equipment
  • Some of the Best Coworkers You'll Ever Meet

People and families come first around here, which is part of why we offer 13 paid holidays (including a week or more shutdown at the end of the year) in addition to vacation.

All applicants must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. to be considered. Sparkbox is not registered internationally or in CA, NY, or IL at this time. 

PLEASE NOTE: Be sure to watch your spam folder after you apply, as some emails from our applicant tracking system find their way to the wrong folder. We never ghost our applicants, so if you haven't heard from us, chances are the email is hiding in your Spam or Promotions folder.

results.title: Operations Manager
results.description:
JOB TITLE: Operations Manager

DIVISION: Nuclear

LOCATION OF WORK: 

Remote – based in one of the following states:

  • Colorado
  • Florida
  • Idaho
  • Minnesota
  • New Jersey
  • New Mexico
  • North Carolina
  • Ohio
  • Oregon
  • Tennessee
  • Utah
  • Virginia
  • Washington D.C.
  • Washington

TRAVEL EXPECTATIONS: Must be willing to relocate to the to-be-determined U.S. MMR facility location.

DESCRIPTION:

The Operations Manager reports to the Manager, Reactor Manufacturing. The Operations Manager responsibilities include:

  • Develop Manufacturing Management Frameworks & Systems for Manufacturing Team; MRP, Maintenance, Lean, CI, HPI,DFA, DFM, Change Control, etc.
  • MRP System Implementation, Financial Planning (CAPEX, OPEX), production scheduling, work cell planning, procurement, etc.
  • Workforce planning & development Skill Set Identification, training program development, integration with local educational institutions
  • Factory & Manufacturing Systems testing and acceptance programs
  • Prototype assembly processes and systems
  • Develop and implement Manufacturing assurance, oversight of manufacturing governance programs


MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

The main responsibilities and authorities for the Operations Manager are:

  • Manufacturing Integration: The Operations Manager is responsible for developing programs, processes and procedures for all aspects of MMR manufacturing including process design, quality assurance, facilities engineering, manufacturing engineering, tool and equipment design, information technology, safety, product development, Lean Six-Sigma, and machinery maintenance. They support Design Engineering in manufacturing process Research and Development, including prototype construction and testing.
  • Must have a broad understanding of all manufacturing processes, with the ability to choose optimized production methods.
  • Must be able to perform break even analyses based on cost, quantity, and other risk factors.
  • Extensive experience in the NQA-1 quality environment, including qualification and commercial grade dedication.
  • Work under both DOE and NRC regulatory oversite a plus.
  • Factory Readiness: As a key member of the Factory Readiness Team, the Operations Manager works closely with Core Division, Construction, Customers, Supply Chain and Logistics to develop and implement integrated corporate systems needed to manage, design, construct, develop the workforce, establish supply chains, commission, and operate the MMR manufacturing facility leveraging standardized and repeatable systems and processes. These systems will ensure that USNC can rapidly deploy manufacturing facilities, manufacture high-quality nuclear components, meet regulatory and quality requirements, meet production goals and do so in a safe, environmentally sound, and financially responsible manner.
  • 20 years o more supply chain management experience is required.
  • Framework Developer: Develops the supply chain structure at the highest levels, including make or buy, sourcing strategies, equipment purchases, and site interfaces and boundaries.
  • Extensive supplier development experience including supplier: identification, support, quality support, and scheduling.
  • Value Engineering: As part of the product and production development phase the manufacturing integration leader works closely with Design Engineering to develop parts, subassemblies and systems that not only meet performance requirements, but are repeatable, interchangeable, and economically producible.
  • Finance: As Manufacturing Integration leader, they work with Finance and the controller to develop and maintain both overhead and project budgets. They develop Basis of Estimates and assist in the proposal process. They are familiar with working in an earned value management system of budgeting and accounting. They implement labor optimization strategies.
  • Staffing: The manufacturing integration manager is also responsible for establishing and developing a management staff for the integration group to include managers of Industrial/Facilities Engineering, QA, Manufacturing Engineering, Information Engineering (IT), Lean Six-Sigma, site specific Integration Managers, Safety and Nuclear Safety.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must possess a BS or BA minimum in Manufacturing Technology, Engineering, Business or a related field. An MBA is preferred.
  • Extensive experience developing and managing Manufacturing Engineering and design of nuclear manufacturing processes for nuclear-grade components and systems. Experience must include implementation of ERP/MRP systems.
  • Experience developing and converting to paperless manufacturing and supply chain processes.
  • Extensive experience managing nuclear facility business systems, manufacturing operations, and associated programs, processes, and procedures including corrective action and root cause analysis programs.
  • Minimum 20 years of Management or Leadership experience in a nuclear environment including experience with Nuclear Safety Culture, Safety Conscious Work Environment, Lean Enterprise Systems, DFA/DFMA, Integrated Safety Management Systems (ISMS), and Design for Six Sigma
  • Strong commitment to employee safety and well-being

PREFERRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCES:

  • Proven ability to implement Lean manufacturing methodology in new and existing production settings. The aptitude to develop Lean practices both at the cell level and factory wide, in both manufacturing and office process settings.
  • Extensive knowledge of Nuclear Safety Systems, Nuclear Change Evaluation, and working in NRC Nuclear licensed and regulated environments
  • Experience developing and implementing Assurance Programs; both NQA-1 and ISO 9001 quality programs and processes, Contractor Assurance, Conduct of Operations/Readiness, and the Software Management Programs.
  • Knowledge of EVMS (Earned Value Management Systems) including budget development and maintenance, (CAM) control account management, and proforma financial forecasting.
  • Understanding of records management and document control (RMDC) systems.
  • Candidate must be a Qualified Six-Sigma Black Belt
  • Must have working knowledge or be familiar with SharePoint, Microsoft Office Suite
  • Have effective communication skills and understanding of the corporate culture with an ability to influence key stakeholders and decision makers across USNC
  • Exceptional leadership, communication, problem solving, and conflict resolution skills
  • Proficient in computer skills and possess the ability to effectively use various analytical, design, project management, and presentation computer programs
  • Required: Data analysis and Statistical skills. Experience with Minitab or other statistical analysis tools.
  • Have excellent verbal, written communication, and time management skills
  • Advanced technical writing skills: develop policies, procedures, guides, and program description documents.
  • Have a strong orientation toward internal and external customers
  • Work with other departments to increase overall strength of the group and company
  • Must be an excellent negotiator and motivator.
  • Possess excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively communicate with others
  • Effectively manage, supervise, motivate, direct, coordinate and provide guidance to the staff of the departments
  • Must be able to not only manage but lead large cross-functional teams of personnel in disbursed locations, and multicultural environments.
  • Possess the ability to influence and motivate stakeholders who are not under your direct operational control.
  • Resolve project and operational issues
  • Analyze and solve problems daily
  • The ability to balance analysis and urgency when making decisions where all of the data may not be readily available.
  • Maintains collaborative, courteous, and respectful relationships
  • Ability to foster a collaborative team environment

TO APPLY:

Please include the following in your application in PDF format:

  • Cover Letter
  • Resume

EXPORT CONTROL REQUIREMENTS:

To confirm to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., or a protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3).

  • Are you legally authorized to work in the United States?

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT:

USNC embraces diversity and equal opportunity and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are striving to build the diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce that will make our technology a reality. USNC actively encourages applicants from historically underrepresented backgrounds to apply to this and other roles, acknowledging and committing to address the historical lack of diversity within the nuclear and aerospace industries.

USNC does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability, or any other legally protected status.

ABOUT ULTRA SAFE NUCLEAR:

Based in Seattle, Ultra Safe Nuclear Corporation (USNC) develops nuclear hardware and services for reliable, clean energy anywhere on Earth and in space. USNC offers full-stack capabilities including specialized reactor design services, advanced materials and fuel development, and reactor manufacturing and system deployment.

USNC has offices in USA, Canada, France, Korea, Poland, South Africa, the UK and more.

results.title: Product Manager, Payments
results.description:
About Us


At Pagos, we’re passionate about empowering businesses to take control of their payments stack and solve the puzzles standing between them and optimized growth. Our global platform provides developers, product teams, and payments leaders with both a deeper understanding of their payments data and access to new payments technology through user-friendly tools that are easy to implement. To succeed in this, we need creative thinkers who are willing to roll up their sleeves and start building alongside us.

 

About the Role

In this role, you’ll play a key part in building our payments intelligence products. This role owns the end-to-end design and delivery of new product features and execution against the product roadmap. 

Pagos Product Managers partner closely with Engineering, Data Science, Design, Content Management and various customer-facing teams to support product implementation and perpetuate a customer-centric mindset.

As a Product Manager, you will:

  • Create and execute actionable product plans with a high level of ownership and visibility

  • Manage a sprint cadence and output in conjunction with machine learning engineering team and data scientist product managers

  • Collaborate with Design and Content Management to create intuitive user paths within the product UI and support content for self help

  • Work closely with Sales and Account Management to lead with the customer in mind

 

What We’re Looking For

We’re looking for someone with:

  • 5+ years of professional experience as a product manager and/or consultant within the fintech industry

  • Experience with building or managing predictive or statistics-based products and/or models

  • Comfort navigating, visualizing, and understanding relational data

  • Excellent communication skills—both written and verbal with the ability to influence and align cross functional groups to drive results

  • Proven ability to manage complex timelines and deliver high quality results 

  • A bias for action, where no task is too small 

  • A diligent focus on customer experience and outcomes

 

Nice to haves: 

  • Business intelligence background

  • Experience in the consumer finance industry

  • SQL experience
